meanings.sent1: The countries formed a coalition to fight against the common enemy.
meanings.sent2: The coalition of students worked together to clean up the park.
meanings.sent3: The coalition of animals decided to throw a party in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The coalition of superheroes joined forces to defeat the villain.
meanings.sent5: The coalition of firefighters rushed to put out the blazing fire.

meanings.definition: A temporary union of political parties.
meanings.sent1: The two parties formed a coalition to gain more votes in the election.
meanings.sent2: The coalition between the parties was necessary to pass the new law.
meanings.sent3: The coalition of politicians decided to have a pizza party to discuss their plans.
meanings.sent4: The coalition of birds worked together to migrate to warmer regions.
meanings.sent5: The coalition of students in the debate club won the competition.
